captions.text:
Whazzap yo? This week on Thug Notes
we gettin ice cold with Wuthering Heights
by Emily Bronte.

So some fool Lockwood arrives at
Thrushcross Grange, a pimpin manor across

the way from another phat crib called Wuthering
Heights. After meeting his emo landlord Heathcliff,

Lockwood hits up the maid Nelly and axe her
to tell him what went down in this hood.

Back in the day, the top dawg of
Wuthering Heights, Mr Earnshaw, picked lil

Heathcliff off da street, and decide to raise
him as his own.

At first, Earnshaw’s two legit kids
Catherine and Hindley can’t stand Heathcliff’s

freeloadin ass! But soon Catherine starts
to get all sweet on my boy and they start

chillin on the reg. Hindley still got beef
though- specially since Earnshaw favors Heathcliff.

When Earnshaw checks out for good,
Hindley puts Heathcliff in his place and makes

him work like a slave. Unacceptable!
Everything’s bumpin til

Heathcliff’s biddy meets Edgar from T-cross
Grange, who starts cockblocking our boy by

layin the mack on Catherine.
Since Edgar’s pants saggin from

them $100 bills and Heathcliff broke as sh**,
Catherine decide she gonna marry Edgar even

though she don’t love him.
But Heathcliff be all like “Naw.

fu** this. I’m out.” and chunks deuce
outta Wuthering Heights.

Years later, Heathcliff comes back
minted like a fu**in balla. Ain’t nobody

know where he got dem swoel dollas from, but
he gonna use it to get back at all dem haters

who dun sh** in his cereal. Heathcliff swindles
Hindley and his son Hareton, jacks Wuthering

Heights, and treats Hindley like a bitch til
he dies. Then he marries Edgar’s sister

Isabella just to get his hands on T-Grange.
After Catherine dies birthin a lil

baby Cathy, Heathcliff’s wife Isabella peaces
out to London where she gives birth to Heathy’s

boy Linton.
10 years later Baby Cathy still

living in T-Grange and Heathcliff got his
boy Linton back. When Linton starts hollerin

at Cathy, Heathcliff forces them to marry
so he can get his grubby hands on T- Grange.

After Linton dies, Heathcliff got it all and
keeps Cathy under lockdown.

After a lot of time and choice
words, Cathy warms up to Hindley’s son Hareton

and they get engaged. But Heathcliff ain’t
never gonna see that day cuz Catherine’s

memory haunts Heathcliff so raw that it kills
him.

Dub Hizzy is a trill example bout
what happens when a playas soul is torn between

between love and hate.
Heathcliff spends the first

half of the book tryna hang on to his hunny
Catherine, all while gettin smacked

around by Hindley. But once Catherine marries
Edgar, Heathcliff feels like he got played
and starts sippin that haterade.

But Heathcliff ain’t bringin his
vengeance to the streets. To wreck these rich

haters, Heathcliff gotta beat them at they
own game. He gets the jump on Hindley by stackin

grands and swiping his hood; then uses his
own wife and kid to get MORE green. And so

for Heathcliff, his wife and kid are just
another commodity to trade.

But it ain’t enough to just burn
all his back when bruthas, he also gotta mess

with the new kids on the block. And the next
generation always ends up mirroring the last.

Just like Heathcliff caught beatdowns from
Hindley left and right, Heathcliff wrecks
Hareton 24/7.

But no matter how lost Heathcliff
gets lookin for vengeance, he’ll always

be haunted by the woman he loves. In fact,
he got exactly what he wanted-

Sparky reads quote: “Catherine Earnshaw,
may you not rest as long as I am living; you

said I killed you – haunt me, then! ... Be
with me always – take any form – drive

me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss,
where I cannot find you!

Peep this symbol, son. Catherine’s
love can go one of two ways.

Wuthering Heights is surrounded by
a whole bunch of nature and crazy weather

representin the hard core passion of Catherine’s
love for Heathy. T-Grange, on the other hand,

is all clean and sheltered which reppin the
easy livin of Catherine’s marriage to the
hood rich Edgar.

When Catherine makes her choice, so does Heathcliff-
revenge. And while love don’t conquer all

in no simple
way, it eventually wins out. Heathcliff drops

his venemous revenge after seeing Hareton
and Cathy gettin fresh , cuz they be reminding
him of Catherine.

And since he reclaims his humanity
by dropping his vengeful grind, H- dog’s

departed soul can finally join the ghost of
Catherine that been haunting him for so long.

When Nelly peeps a scared boy
crying and axe him what’s wrong he says:

Sparky reads quote: “There’s Heathcliff
and a woman yonder, under t’nab,’... I

darnut pass ‘em.” (325) animation with
quote and image of ghosts holding hands.

Thanks for tunin in, my well read
thugz! Stay smart and stay in school!

title: Wuthering Heights - Thug Notes Summary and Analysis
